title: All the true-crime documentaries to binge on NOW TV
text:
There’s a whole load of true-crime docs on NOW TV (Pictures: HBO/Getty/Metro.co.uk)

Obsessed with true-crime documentaries but have no idea what to watch on NOW TV? Fear no more, because we’ve got your back.

We’ve delved through all the captivating series and films available to binge on the streaming service just in time for Halloween.

So whether you’re desperate to know more about the make-up of the most twisted killers, or keen to learn more about what makes women kill, then look no further.

How I Caught The Killer

A 10-part crime series revealing, like never before, what it’s like to be a police officer working on the most incredible and inconceivable murder cases in criminal history.

From exploring the murder of Christoper Donovan by a gang of youths to The Camden Ripper, this documentary programme explores a wealth of horrific crimes both in the UK and across the pond.

I Love You, Now Die

Were Michelle Carter’s texts urging boyfriend Conrad Roy to end his own life criminal?

This two-part documentary investigates.

The Iceman Tapes

The Iceman Tapes is a documentary film with interviews diving deep into the mind of the ruthless Mafia hitman, Richard ‘The Iceman’ Kuklinski.

First airing in 1991, this 47-minute movie will certainly give you chills.

The Iceman And The Psychologist

Once you’re done with The Iceman Tapes, turn your attention to this 50-minute film which reveals morbid conversations and confessions from Kuklinski with a psychiatrist.

Killer Colleagues

Watch what happens when office relationships take a deadly turn, as this true-crime series walks you through the arrests, investigations and quest for justice.

A bizarre and twisted workplace love triangle is revealed when three hotel workers go missing and the police make a grisly discovery.

In Ice Cold Blood

To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

American rapper Ice-T hosts the show that dives into the most chilling of true crime stories, each centering around a cold-blooded murder fuelled by greed or lust.

Advertisement

Advertisement

There are two episodes available on NOW TV for your viewing pleasure, with one looking into a twisted tale involving a foursome, a stripper and a biker.

Conman: The Life And Crimes Of Mark Acklom

This documentary film follows the story of a cunning fraudster who posed as an MI6 agent to con his ex-girlfriend out of almost £300,000.

Earlier this year, Acklom was sentenced to five years and eight months behind bars for his crimes.

Mark Acklom is a serial conman (Picture: PA)

The Hunt For The Shoe Rapist

To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

This documentary film tells the story of how, 20 years after the crimes took place, South Yorkshire Police were able to find the South Yorkshire Shoe Rapist, responsible for attacking six women during the 1980s.

Waco: Clive Doyle: In Defense Of

This is a documentary series that revisits the most shocking and notorious criminal cases from the unique perspective of the defense attorneys who represented the perpetrators.

There are two episodes to sink your teeth into, with one hearing from Ted Bundy’s defence lawyer.

Fred And Rose: The Unanswered Questions

More than two decades after the police first searched the Gloucester home of Fred and Rose West, this documentary questions how many more girls the couple might have killed.

Advertisement

The Sky special film has a run-time of 44-minutes and looks into the couple’s chilling crimes.

Rose West and her husband Fred was convicted of 10 murders in 1995 (Picture: Rex)

Snapped

Snapped is a true-crime series examining the shocking details of high-profile or bizarre murders committed by women.

There are 11 episodes on NOW TV to binge, with installments looking into disturbing cases such as the drug-related death of Ajelina Lewis’s boyfriend.

Tales Of The Grim Sleeper

To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

In this immersive film, award-winning documentary maker Nick Broomfield probes the case of the notorious Los Angeles serial killer known as the Grim Sleeper.

The Grim Sleeper is the nickname for convicted serial killer Lonnie David Franklin Jr, who is responsible for at least 10 murders and one attempted murder in Los Angeles, California

The attacker was handed his title because he appeared to have taken a 14-year break from his crimes between the years 1988 to 2002.

Double Murder

The story of how in June 2005, police made the grim discovery of two Polish brothers who had been brutally murdered by extreme blunt force trauma, and the investigation that ensued.

Advertisement

This 52-minute long documentary gives a detailed account of the case and what went down.

Golden State Killer: Unmasked

To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

Golden State Killer: Unmasked is a seven-part series that explores the chilling case some 40 years later.

After police finally made an arrest in the Golden State Killer cold case in 2018, discover how the hunt for one of America’s most prolific serial killers was reopened.

The Case Against Adnan Syed

To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

Brace yourself. This four-part documentary gives a fresh look at the 1999 murder of Baltimore student Hae Min Lee, and the subsequent conviction of her ex-boyfriend, Adnan Syed.

The series hopes to finally learn the truth 20 years after the case came to light.

Britain’s Most Evil Killers

This series examines some of the most dangerous and prolific murderers in the UK, uncovering what drove them to commit such heinous crimes.

From Ian Huntley to The Grindr Killer Stephen Port and Raoul Moat, this will no doubt peak your interest. Oh, and there are three seasons to binge on.

Stephen Port is known as The Grindr Killer (Picture: PA)

The Mark Of A Killer

An eye-opening two-part show that explores the bizarre behaviours and rituals of some of the most brutal murderers.

One episode looks into the crimes of The Gainesville Ripper, who killed five students at the University of Florida and left the women posed like dolls, while the other uncovers a killer who sought their victims in plain sight.

The Jinx: The Life And Times Of Robert Durst

To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

This six-part Emmy-winning documentary investigates reclusive real estate mogul and murder suspect Robert Durst.

Robert Durst was the suspect and he is alleged to have confessed to a number of murders, including that of his wife Kathleen “Kathie” McCormack who went missing in 1982.

When audio of the suspect talking to himself in the toilet and allegedly confessing to ‘killing them all’, played out in the final episode of Sky Crime’s The Jinx, it seemed almost too good to be true.

Inside Evil

Chris Cuomo goes inside a maximum-security prison for an exclusive interview with America’s most dangerous minds in a five-part investigative series exploring the psyche of criminal offenders.

Inside Evil sees Chris come face-to-face with notorious killer Joel Rifkin as well as the Spahalski twins, who are both convicted murderers.

World’s Most Evil Killers

The series is compiled of interviews from the detectives who worked the cases and victims who survived their attacks, this series looks at some of the most prolific serial killers the world has ever seen.

From John Wayne Gacy to Edmund Kemper and Cary Stayner there are two series waiting to be unraveled.

Capturing The Friedmans

This Academy-Award nominated film focuses on the 1980s investigation of Arnold and Jesse Friedman for child molestation

It explores a family’s disintegration amid the turmoil of both the father and youngest son being charged with sex crimes.
